title: Rustpkg fails with nonexistent_package after previous rustpkg compilation fails
body:
After a failed `rustpkg install github.com/JeremyLetang/rust-sfml`, running that command a 2nd time generates a `nonexistent_package` error.  This has occured when the initial `rustpkg install` failed on `ld` or on `rustc`.

```
$ TMPDIR=/home/steve/.tmp rustpkg install github.com/JeremyLetang/rust-sfml
...
error: aborting due to previous error
task '<unnamed>' failed at 'explicit failure', /home/steve/src/rust/src/libsyntax/diagnostic.rs:75
task '<unnamed>' failed at 'receiving on a closed channel', /home/steve/src/rust/src/libstd/comm/mod.rs:743

$ TMPDIR=/home/steve/.tmp rustpkg install github.com/JeremyLetang/rust-sfml
WARNING: The Rust package manager is experimental and may be unstable
task '<unnamed>' failed at 'Unhandled condition: nonexistent_package: 

(crate_id::CrateId{
path: std::path::posix::Path{
    repr: ~[103u8, 105u8, 116u8, 104u8, 117u8, 98u8, 46u8, 99u8, 111u8, 109u8], sepidx: None}, 
    short_name: ~"github", version: NoVersion},
 ~"supplied path for package dir does not exist, and couldn't interpret it as a URL fragment")', 
/home/steve/src/rust/src/libstd/condition.rs:139
```

```
$ rustpkg -v
WARNING: The Rust package manager is experimental and may be unstable
rustpkg 0.10-pre (2ff358c 2014-01-17 15:46:40 -0800)
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

$ rustc -v
rustc 0.10-pre (2ff358c 2014-01-17 15:46:40 -0800)
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
```
